cms.name: Drupal
cms.intro: Drupal is an open source content management platform powering millions of websites and applications. It’s built, used, and supported by an active and diverse community of people around the world.

cms.name: Joomla
cms.intro: Joomla is an award-winning content management system (CMS), which enables you to build Web sites and powerful online applications.

cms.name: WordPress
cms.intro: WordPress is web software you can use to create a beautiful website or blog. We like to say that WordPress is both free and priceless at the same time.

css.name: Less
css.intro: Less is a CSS pre-processor, meaning that it extends the CSS language, adding features that allow variables, mixins, functions and many other techniques that allow you to make CSS that is more maintainable, themable and extendable.

css.name: Sass
css.intro: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.

framework.name: Bootstrap
framework.intro: Bootstrap is the most popular HTML, CSS, and JS framework for developing responsive, mobile first projects on the web.

framework.name: Foundation
framework.intro: The most advanced responsive front-end framework in the world.

framework.name: Amaze UI
framework.intro: 中国首个开源 HTML5 跨屏前端框架

general.name: jQuery
general.intro: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, animation, and Ajax much simpler with an easy-to-use API that works across a multitude of browsers. With a combination of versatility and extensibility, jQuery has changed the way that millions of people write JavaScript.

general.name: YUI
general.intro: YUI is a free, open source JavaScript and CSS library for building richly interactive web applications.

general.name: Zepto
general.intro: Zepto is a minimalist JavaScript library for modern browsers with a largely jQuery-compatible API. If you use jQuery, you already know how to use Zepto.

general.name: Dojo Toolkit
general.intro: Dojo is a free, open-source JavaScript toolkit for building high performance web applications.

jquery.name: jQuery
jquery.intro: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, animation, and Ajax much simpler with an easy-to-use API that works across a multitude of browsers. With a combination of versatility and extensibility, jQuery has changed the way that millions of people write JavaScript.

jquery.name: jQuery UI
jquery.intro: jQuery UI is a curated set of user interface interactions, effects, widgets, and themes built on top of the jQuery JavaScript Library. Whether you're building highly interactive web applications or you just need to add a date picker to a form control, jQuery UI is the perfect choice.

jquery.name: jQuery Mobile
jquery.intro: jQuery Mobile is a HTML5-based user interface system designed to make responsive web sites and apps that are accessible on all smartphone, tablet and desktop devices.

jquery.name: Sizzle
jquery.intro: A pure-JavaScript CSS selector engine designed to be easily dropped in to a host library.

jquery.name: Qunit
jquery.intro: QUnit is a powerful, easy-to-use JavaScript unit testing framework. It's used by the jQuery, jQuery UI and jQuery Mobile projects and is capable of testing any generic JavaScript code, including itself!

library.name: Handlebars
library.intro: An extension to the Mustache templating language.

library.name: React
library.intro: A JAVASCRIPT LIBRARY FOR BUILDING USER INTERFACES

library.name: Polymer
library.intro: Polymer is a new type of library for the web, built on top of Web Components, and designed to leverage the evolving web platform on modern browsers.

library.name: Angular
library.intro: Angular is a development platform for building mobile and desktop web applications

loader.name: RequireJS
loader.intro: A file and module loader for JavaScript.

loader.name: SeaJS
loader.intro: A Module Loader for the Web.

package.name: npm
package.intro: npm is the package manager for javascript.

package.name: Bower
package.intro: A package manager for the web.

package.name: spm
package.intro: Brand new static package manager for browser.

resource.name: W3schools
resource.intro: W3Schools is optimized for learning, testing, and training. Examples might be simplified to improve reading and basic understanding.

resource.name: Htmlgoodies
resource.intro: A team of developers created an HTML5 app for a major website that offers a much more sophisticated user experience on each of the mobile platforms commonly in use today. The tools they used eliminated much of the custom coding required to bring the desired features to each platform.

resource.name: Quackit
resource.intro: Ian initially created Quackit in order to point web developers to resources that could potentially help them build better websites. Some of these resources were available from the Quackit website itself, others were from third party websites.

resource.name: Html
resource.intro: People often think it is extremely difficult to make a website. That is not the case! Everyone can learn how to make a website. Use our tutorials on HTML and CSS and PHP and JavaScript and start building your own website in about an hour.

resource.name: Tizag
resource.intro: Tizag was designed to teach beginner web programmers how to use HTML and CSS. We invite you to begin the tutorials right away.

resource.name: Htmldog
resource.intro: Welcome to HTML Dog, the web designer’s resource for everything HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, the most common technologies used in making web pages.

resource.name: Pageresource
resource.intro: Pageresource is a Web Development Tutorial and Information Site.

resource.name: Htmlcodetutorial
resource.intro: Welcome to the HTML Code Tutorial. Our goal is to provide the most helpful and complete guide to creating web pages anywhere.

resource.name: Tuts+
resource.intro: Tuts+ helps you learn creative skills and shape the life you want.

resource.name: Webreference
resource.intro: One of the oldest (created in 1995) and most respected Web development sites, WebReference.com is all about the Web and Webmastery. From browsing to authoring, HTML to advanced site design, we’ll keep you informed.

workflow.name: Yeoman
workflow.intro: THE WEB'S SCAFFOLDING TOOL FOR MODERN WEBAPPS

plus.name: Git
plus.intro: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

plus.name: Node.js
plus.intro: Node.js® is a platform built on Chrome's JavaScript runtime for easily building fast, scalable network applications. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient, perfect for data-intensive real-time applications that run across distributed devices.
